Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class Gui

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<java.lang.Object>
it.polimi.ingsw.view.View
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.Gui
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<Update>
public class Gui
extends View
implements Observer<Update>
Gui class represents Graphic User Interface part of the project. The game can be played through a command-line interface or a graphic environment; project purposes are those of creating a "complete" Gui, so all what can be done with Cli is possible with Gui too. This class handles general graphic part of the application; then, many components are used to implement particular screens, situations, ... Gui and Cli class share a lot of different aspects, so they both extend View class. This class observes Update because Model's state changes (MVC pattern) arrive through Update, and they determine changes in what is displayed on screen too.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Gui getInstance​(Client client, Controller controller)
      The method returns Gui class' instance, following Singleton design pattern. If no instance exists, it is created and associated with parameters.
      Parameters:
      client - client associated to requested Gui
      controller - controller (client-side) of the other parameter
      Returns:
      Gui instance (if not existing, it is created)

    • getInstance

      public static Gui getInstance()
      The method returns local instance of Gui class, following Singleton design pattern. If no instance exists, it is created.
      Returns:
      Gui instance (if not existing, it is created)

    • getFont

      public static java.awt.Font getFont​(int fontMode, int size)
      The method returns the correct font for writing on graphic user interface, based on the parameters. Only some selected fonts are possible: in this way, all Gui components will use coherent fonts.
      Parameters:
      fontMode - font type (bold or not)
      size - font size
      Returns:
      font with selected type and size; in case of exceptions, a generic font is returned

    • getMainFrame

      public javax.swing.JFrame getMainFrame()
      The method is the getter for Gui main frame.
      Returns:
      Gui main frame

    • getGodGuiDrawer

      public GodGuiDrawer getGodGuiDrawer()
      This method returns a reference to the user GodGuiDrawer, in order to draw specific buttons for the user's god (if necessary).
      Returns:
      a reference to the correct user's GodGuiDrawer

    • setPlayersGods

      public void setPlayersGods​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> playersGods)
      The method sets correspondence between players and Gods, after these ones have been selected. A graphic operation related to this is also performed.
      Overrides:
      setPlayersGods in class View
      Parameters:
      playersGods - correspondence between Gods and players

    • setPlayersColors

      public void setPlayersColors​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​PrintableColor> playersColors)
      The method sets correspondence between players and colors, after these ones have been selected. A graphic operation related to this is also performed.
      Overrides:
      setPlayersColors in class View
      Parameters:
      playersColors - correspondence between colors and players

    • start

      public void start()
      The method starts graphic user interface, so this is the entry point for users who want to play a match with graphic environment.
      Specified by:
      start in class View

    • update

      public void update​(Update update)
      The method handles Updates, which most of the times correspond to graphic changes. In reality, what really manages Updates is a proper update handler for Gui class.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<Update>
      Parameters:
      update - update received (originally coming from server)

    • startWaitingForMatch

      public void startWaitingForMatch()
      The method starts graphic visualization for the phase in which a player waits for other people, in order to start a match. Before this, selected player number for the match is sent to server.

    • setSelectableColors

      public void setSelectableColors​(java.util.List<PrintableColor> selectableColors)
      The method calls the proper component in order to set the list of selectable colors at the current moment. In fact, when a color is selected by one of the players, no one can select it again during this match.
      Specified by:
      setSelectableColors in class View
      Parameters:
      selectableColors - list of selectable colors at current time

    • setSelectedNicknames

      public void setSelectedNicknames​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedNicknames)
      The method calls the proper component in order to set the list of already chosen nicknames for the match. In fact, when a nickname is chosen by one of the players, no one can choose it again during this match.
      Specified by:
      setSelectedNicknames in class View
      Parameters:
      selectedNicknames - list of already selected nicknames

    • setSelectableGods

      public void setSelectableGods​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectableGods)
      The method calls the proper component in order to set the list of selectable Gods at the current moment. In fact, only Gods in this list can be chosen by the player who plays the current turn.
      Specified by:
      setSelectableGods in class View
      Parameters:
      selectableGods - list of selectable gods at current time

    • showLoseMessageDialog

      public void showLoseMessageDialog​(LoseUpdate update)
      The method creates a dialog to manage the situation in which one of the players loses. The player is notified of his/her loss, with a brief explanation about it. In general, if the match continues, the player who loses can decide whether to continue to watch or quit.
      Parameters:
      update - update coming form server, which first sees the losing situation

    • askPlayAgainDialog

      public void askPlayAgainDialog()
      The method creates a dialog to ask the player if he/she wants to play another match. This dialog can be visualized, for example, when a match ends, or when a player wants to leave the match and maybe wants to start another one. Decision by the player is managed in the proper way.

    • showServerUnreachableDialog

      public void showServerUnreachableDialog()
      The method creates a dialog to manage the situation in which server is unreachable. In this case, the player is notified with a brief possible explanation of the problem; after that, the game is closed, since it is an online game. Server can be unreachable for a connection problem, because it is down or for other reasons.

    • showDisconnectedPlayerDialog

      public void showDisconnectedPlayerDialog​(DisconnectedPlayerUpdate update)
      The method creates a dialog to manage the situation in which one of the players disconnects from the match. In this case, all other players are notified and the match immediately ends.
      Parameters:
      update - update coming form server, which first sees the disconnection (through ping messages)
